message_1:
Solve the inequality:
2x + 3 > 9 - x 

Write the solution as an interval on the number line.
message_2:
To solve the inequality 2x + 3 > 9 - x, follow these steps:

Step 1: Add x to both sides of the inequality.
2x + x + 3 > 9 - x + x
3x + 3 > 9

Step 2: Subtract 3 from both sides of the inequality.
3x + 3 - 3 > 9 - 3
3x > 6

Step 3: Divide both sides of the inequality by 3.
3x / 3 > 6 / 3
x > 2

The solution to the inequality is x > 2. As an interval on the number line, this can be written as (2, ∞).
